stages.title: 회의 시작 및 안건 소개
stages.intent: 비즈니스 회의를 전문적으로 시작하고 안건을 명확히 소개하며 참석자들의 주의를 집중시킨다.
lexset: meeting, agenda, discuss, review, address, welcome, purpose, objective, schedule, priority

seeds.en: Let's begin today's meeting.
The first item on the agenda is budget review.
We'll discuss this quarter's performance.
Welcome everyone to the meeting.
The main purpose today is strategy revision.
We have limited time, so let's be efficient.
First, let's review the results from our last meeting.
Please feel free to ask questions at any time.
We'll address the high-priority issues first.
Has everyone received the meeting materials?

stages.title: 의견 제시 및 근거 설명
stages.intent: 비즈니스 맥락에서 자신의 의견을 논리적으로 제시하고 구체적인 근거와 데이터로 뒷받침한다.
lexset: suggest, propose, recommend, believe, analysis, data, evidence, statistics, research, findings
traps: I think vs I believe vs I suggest 구분
근거 제시 연결어 (because, since, due to)

seeds.kr: 제 의견으로는 마케팅 예산을 늘려야 합니다.
seeds.en: In my opinion, we should increase the marketing budget.
According to the data, customer satisfaction has improved.

seeds.kr: 연구 결과를 바탕으로 새로운 전략을 제안합니다.
seeds.en: Based on research findings, I propose a new strategy.
From experience, this approach is more effective.
The statistics show a clear trend.

seeds.kr: 분석 결과 두 가지 옵션을 고려해볼 수 있습니다.
seeds.en: The analysis suggests we consider two options.
There are three reasons for this.
The evidence supports this conclusion.

seeds.kr: 시장 조사에 의하면 수요가 증가하고 있습니다.
seeds.en: Market research indicates increasing demand.
I strongly recommend this approach.

stages.title: 동의 및 반대 표현
stages.intent: 비즈니스 회의에서 전문적이고 정중하게 동의나 반대 의견을 표현하며 건설적인 토론을 이끈다.
lexset: agree, disagree, support, oppose, concern, issue, alternative, perspective, valid, point
traps: 부분 동의 표현 (I agree to some extent)

seeds.en: I completely agree with that opinion.
That's a valid point, but there's another perspective.
I agree to some extent, but I have concerns.
I'm sorry, but I have to disagree with that proposal.
Let me suggest an alternative.
I support that idea.

seeds.kr: 다른 접근법을 고려해 볼 수 있을까요?
seeds.en: Could we consider a different approach?
That's exactly right.
I have a different opinion on that point.
That's an excellent suggestion.

stages.title: 회의 결론 및 다음 단계
stages.intent: 회의 내용을 요약하고 결정사항을 정리하며 구체적인 실행 계획과 책임자를 명확히 정한다.
lexset: conclude, summarize, decide, action, responsibility, deadline, follow-up, implement, assign, next
traps: 미래 시제 정확한 사용 (will vs going to)

seeds.en: In conclusion, we've decided to adopt the new strategy.

seeds.kr: 김 과장님이 이 프로젝트를 담당하시게 됩니다.
seeds.en: Manager Kim will be responsible for this project.
We need to complete the report by next week.
Let me summarize what we discussed today.
The next meeting will be on Monday.
We need to develop an action plan.
We'll track progress through weekly reports.
We made three decisions in this meeting.
These are the items that require follow-up.
Thank you all for your participation.

stages.title: 프레젠테이션 도입 및 목적 제시
stages.intent: 청중의 관심을 끌고 프레젠테이션의 목적과 구조를 명확히 제시하여 효과적인 발표를 시작한다.
lexset: presentation, introduce, overview, outline, structure, objective, cover, demonstrate, explain, highlight
traps: 미래 시제 (I will explain vs I'm going to show)
청중 언급 (ladies and gentlemen vs everyone)

seeds.en: I'd like to begin today's presentation.
Let me start by introducing myself.

seeds.kr: 오늘의 목적은 새로운 제품을 소개하는 것입니다.
seeds.en: The purpose of today's presentation is to introduce our new product.
I'll divide this into three parts.
First, let's look at the current situation.
This chart will make it clear.
I'll take questions after the presentation.
This should take about 20 minutes.
I'll highlight the key points.

seeds.kr: 여러분의 관심을 끌고 싶은 것이 있습니다.
seeds.en: There's something I'd like to draw your attention to.

stages.title: 데이터 설명 및 분석
stages.intent: 차트, 그래프, 수치 데이터를 명확하게 설명하고 비즈니스적 의미를 분석하여 전달한다.
lexset: increase, decrease, rise, fall, percentage, graph, chart, trend, significant, dramatic, steady
traps: 변화 동사 시제 (has increased vs increased)

seeds.en: Sales have increased by 20%.

seeds.kr: 이 그래프는 지속적인 상승 추세를 보여줍니다.
seeds.en: This graph shows a steady upward trend.
There's been significant improvement compared to last year.
Let's look at the figures in detail.
Market share has dropped dramatically.
What this data shows is clear.
This shows the change from peak to lowest point.
We're growing at an average of 10% per month.
The results exceed our expectations.
The outlook for next quarter is positive.

stages.title: 결론 및 권고사항
stages.intent: 프레젠테이션의 핵심 내용을 요약하고 구체적이고 실행 가능한 권고사항을 제시한다.
lexset: recommend, suggest, propose, implement, strategy, solution, benefit, advantage, result, outcome
traps: 권고 표현 (recommend vs suggest vs advise)
조건부 표현 (If we implement this, we will...)

seeds.en: In conclusion, I recommend implementing the new system.

seeds.kr: 이 전략의 주요 이점은 비용 절감입니다.
seeds.en: The main benefit of this strategy is cost reduction.
This is a solution we can implement immediately.
The expected outcomes are as follows.

seeds.kr: 이 제안을 채택하면 경쟁 우위를 확보할 수 있습니다.
seeds.en: Adopting this proposal will give us a competitive advantage.

seeds.kr: 투자 대비 수익률이 높을 것으로 예상됩니다.
seeds.en: We expect a high return on investment.

seeds.kr: 3개월 내에 결과를 볼 수 있을 것입니다.
seeds.en: We should see results within three months.
We'll need cooperation from all departments.

seeds.kr: 리스크는 최소화하고 이익은 극대화할 수 있습니다.
seeds.en: We can minimize risks while maximizing benefits.
As the next step, I propose a pilot program.

stages.title: Q&A 및 피드백 처리 (Bridge)
stages.intent: 질문에 전문적으로 대답하고 피드백을 수용하며 추가 논의를 효과적으로 관리한다.
lexset: question, clarify, explain, elaborate, feedback, comment, point, understand, appreciate, address

seeds.en: That's an excellent question.
Let me elaborate on that point.
I'd like to clarify what you mean exactly.
I'll check on that and get back to you.
Thank you for that valuable feedback.
I see you're looking at it from a different perspective.
You've pointed out something I missed.
There's a way to address that concern.

seeds.kr: 더 질문 있으시면 언제든 말씀해 주세요.
seeds.en: Please feel free to ask if you have more questions.
Due to time constraints, I'll take one final question.

stages.title: 조건부 제안 및 협상 시작
stages.intent: 비즈니스 협상에서 조건부 제안을 하고 상대방의 요구사항을 파악하며 협상 분위기를 조성한다.
lexset: propose, offer, condition, terms, agreement, negotiate, discuss, consider, flexible, requirements
traps: 조건문 정확한 사용 (If you..., we will...)

seeds.kr: 만약 수량을 늘리신다면 할인을 제공할 수 있습니다.
seeds.en: If you increase the quantity, we could offer a discount.
I'd like to hear your requirements.
We propose the following terms.
Let's find a mutually beneficial solution.
We have some flexibility in this matter.
Let's discuss the contract terms.
We'll do our best within your budget range.
Let me suggest an alternative.
Would you consider this proposal?
This is a fair deal for both parties.

stages.title: 양보 및 대안 제시
stages.intent: 협상 과정에서 적절한 양보를 하고 창의적인 대안을 제시하여 합의점을 찾아간다.
lexset: compromise, concession, alternative, option, adjust, modify, reconsider, trade-off, balance, middle
traps: 조건부 양보 (provided that, as long as)

seeds.en: We can adjust the price.
Let's find a middle ground.
There might be another way.
Let me modify the terms and make a new proposal.
We can make concessions on delivery terms.
Instead, we can offer other benefits.
We need to find a compromise.
We can create a win-win situation.
We could reconsider under those conditions.
Let me propose a package deal.

stages.title: 문제 해결 언어
stages.intent: 고객의 문제나 불만을 전문적으로 처리하고 효과적인 해결책을 제시한다.
lexset: problem, issue, concern, solution, resolve, address, apologize, understand, investigate, improve

seeds.en: I apologize for any inconvenience caused.
I understand the problem.
I'll investigate this immediately.
Let me find a solution for you.

seeds.kr: 이런 일이 다시 발생하지 않도록 하겠습니다.
seeds.en: We'll ensure this doesn't happen again.
I completely understand your position.
I'll look into compensation options.
Let me identify the root cause.
We'll develop an improvement plan.
Your feedback is very important to us.

stages.title: 확정 및 거래 마무리
stages.intent: 협상이나 거래를 성공적으로 마무리하고 향후 관계를 위한 기반을 다진다.
lexset: finalize, confirm, agreement, contract, handshake, deal, partnership, cooperation, future, relationship

seeds.en: Let's finalize the contract.
This has been a successful deal.
I look forward to a great partnership.
We've agreed on all terms.
We'll sign the contract.
Let's discuss future cooperation.
This is a satisfactory outcome.
We'll prepare the documents next week.
We'll stay in touch.
It's a pleasure doing business with you.
